headerText: The `v-icon` component provides a large set of glyphs to provide context to various aspects of your application. For a list of all available icons, visit the official [Material Design Icons](https://materialdesignicons.com/) page.

usage.desc: Icons come in two themes (light and dark), and five different sizes (x-small, small, medium (default), large, and x-large).

fontAwesome.desc: [Font Awesome](http://fontawesome.io/icons/) is also supported. Simply use the `fa-` prefixed icon name. Please note that you still need to include the Font Awesome icons in your project. For more information on how to install it, please navigate to the [installation page](/framework/icons#install-font-awesome-5-icons)

md.desc: [Material Design](https://material.io/tools/icons/?style=baseline) is also supported. For more information on how to install it please [navigate here](/framework/icons#install-material-icons)

color.desc: Using color helpers you can change the color of an icon from the standard dark and light themes.

buttons.desc: Icons can be used inside of buttons to add emphasis to the action.

clickable.desc: Binding any click event to `v-icon` will automatically change the cursor to a pointer.

mdiSvg.desc: You can manually import only the icons you use when using the [@mdi/js](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@mdi/js) package. If you want to use SVG icons with `VIcon` component, read about using them [here](/framework/icons#install-material-design-icons-js-svg).

props.left: Places the icon on the left, when used inside a button
props.right: Places the icon on the right, when used inside a button
